questions.question: Reconnaissance: Who could be the target of a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) attack?
questions.optionA: A random user of a website
questions.optionB: A frequent user of a website
questions.explaination: Anyone using a website can be the target, although the attacker may target a specific individual

questions.question: Reconnaissance: What might be vulnerable to a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) attack?
questions.explaination: The most common vulnerabilities exploited are poor or no input validation or the input data not being encoded

questions.question: Weaponization: Which of these are not how a malicious script may try to evade detection?
questions.optionC: Filtering by web application or browser
questions.explaination: Putting the script in a zip file will not help evade detection, as it will not change the actual code

questions.question: Weaponization: What is the most common programming language used for XSS attacks?
questions.explaination: The vast majority of XXS attacks use scripts created in JavaScript, with HTML also being quite common

questions.question: Delivery: Which XSS attack involves a malicious script being installed on a website's server?
questions.explaination: Reflected XSS attacks are reflected off the server, rather than stored. Document Object Model based attacks are carried by modifying the original client side script

questions.question: Delivery: Which XSS attack could involve the user clicking a malicious link?
questions.explaination: Stored XSS attacks are stored on a server, rather than relying on a link being clicked. Document Object Model based attacks are carried by modifying the original client side script

questions.question: Delivery: Which XSS attack is also known as client-side XSS?
questions.explaination: Both Reflected ans Stored XSS attacks use servers, while DOM based attacks modify the original client side script

questions.question: Exploitation: What can an XSS attack do?
questions.optionB: Send requests to the web server
questions.optionC: Access the victim's cookies or local storage
questions.explaination: The attacker might be able to do one of these actions or multiple at the same time, based on what they want to achieve

questions.question: Exploitation: Who/What executes the malicious script?
questions.explaination: Neither the user nor the attacker tend to execute the code, it is usually the victim's web browser thaat runs the script

questions.question: Installation: Which of the following could an XSS script install?
questions.explaination: An XSS attack can install various malicious programs or malware, including the 3 listed

questions.question: Installation: What might an XSS attack install?
questions.optionA: A script that runs everytime the victim visits the web application
questions.optionB: A web shell that allows the attacker to remotely execute commands
questions.optionD: An XSS attack can't install anything
questions.explaination: An XSS attack can install code that will repeatedly run, or a web shell the attacker can use remotely, amongst other options

questions.question: Command and Control (C2): How does the attacker communicate with the malicious code?
questions.explaination: The attacker has a variety of options for communication with the code, with all 3 being possible

questions.question: Command and Control(C2): What can the attacker do after an attack is initiated?
questions.explaination: Depending on the attackers goals, they could do all 3 of these things or one specifically

questions.question: Actions on Objectives: What might be the desired outcome of a successful attack?
questions.optionB: Remote control of the victim's web browser
questions.explaination: XSS attacks are typically used to gain priveleges, control of a users browser or to steal sensitive information

questions.question: Actions on Objectives: Which is unlikely to be the goal of an XSS attack?
questions.optionB: Remote control of the victim's web browser
questions.explaination: If the goal is to take a website offline, a DDoS attack would be a more likely approach
